Articles.Content:
So, I don't think this has been posted before. So lets do it now!

What is your personality type? Well, type according to the Carl Jung and Isabel Briggs Myers typological approach to personality. I'm sure there are other classification systems, but this one is well established and insightful.

>>> Take the test here <<<

If you already know your type just post that. Or if you want to take another test instead of the one linked above, that's fine too.

I would post a poll, but there are 16 types and a max limit of 10 poll options . So instead I will just edit this post to table them here. I'm interested to see the results, I suspect they will not match up well with the general populace.

As for me, my tests have returned INTJ and INTP on later occasion. So I am borderline J/P, so probably drifting to P. Drift can happen over time... i'm getting soft with age!

edit: Interesting website here if you are interested in seeing famous people that share your type.

http://www.celebritytypes.com/

edit: I have setup a table now.

Type	#	%	Gen. Pop %
---------------------------------------
INTP	16	26.67	3.3
INTJ	25	41.67	2.1
INFP	4	6.67	4.4
INFJ	1	1.67	1.46
ISTJ	1	1.67	11.6
ISFJ	0	0.00	13.8
ISTP	2	3.33	5.4
ISFP	0	0.00	8.8
ENTP	2	3.33	3.2
ENTJ	5	8.33	1.8
ENFP	1	1.67	8.1
ENFJ	2	3.33	2.5
ESTJ	0	0.00	8.7
ESFJ	0	0.00	12.3
ESTP	1	1.67	4.3
ESFP	0	0.00	8.5
---------------------------------------
 total	60	100.00
---------------------------------------
Intro	49	81.67
Extr	11	18.33
iNtu	56	93.33
Sens	4	6.67
Think	52	86.67
Feel	8	13.33
Perce	26	43.33
Judg	34	56.67

Edited September 27, 2014 by bsalis

According to my run through the test today, I'm an INFP. Years ago I was an INTJ. I guess the tumbling rivers of life and time have worn down my sharp corners and turned me into a smooth, rolling pebble.

But then I used to be an arch-rationalist/skeptic, now I'm what I'd call post- or trans-rational. (smiles) Perhaps a better term is 'possibilian'. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Possibilianism

And over the years I've shifted from libertarian to anarchist/voluntaryist.

I just took the test a second time, and here are my detailed results, in case anyone wants to do a more involved statistical analysis:

INFP - Introvert(56%) iNtuitive(62%) Feeling(38%) Perceiving(44%)

You have moderate preference of Introversion over Extraversion (56%)

You have distinct preference of Intuition over Sensing (62%)

You have moderate preference of Feeling over Thinking (38%)

You have moderate preference of Perceiving over Judging (44%)

Edited May 13, 2014 by pebble_garden
Added more detailed results from the test.

INTP

Introvert(78%) iNtuitive(50%) Thinking(62%) Perceiving(11%)

I'll just paste this I guess.

ENFJ

Extravert(11%) iNtuitive(50%) Feeling(31%) Judging(1%)

Here is mine. Hmm, most of use have some Intuitive in us.

i have INTP

Introvert(89%) iNtuitive(19%) Thinking(50%) Perceiving(33%)

then again not really surprising for me

Ok - so I have put a table up now that we have some data points.

Hmm, most of us have some Intuitive in us.

Actually, everyone so far. I'm sure that that some S types will be represented soon enough.

I won't do that, I've already answered hundreds of those questions during medicals for the Air Force!!

(Yes, I'm applying to became pilot of the Italian Air Force )

Edited May 3, 2014 by PlonioFludrasco

As for me, my tests have returned INTJ and INTP on later occasion. So I am borderline J/P

Similar... INTJ and INFP, here. Odd that those two parameters are so centerline... but I'm very strongly in the IN camp.

ENTJ. Can't say I'm surprised though... I've been preparing for OCS for a year haha

Edited May 3, 2014 by horndgmium

INTJ

Introvert(67%) iNtuitive(12%) Thinking(75%) Judging(44%)
I did the test like 5 years ago in College. Got an INTP. I did the test not too long ago and got an INTP again. I think most of us here will be "NT" types.
I did the test multiple times and in most occasions I show as a 50/50 between INTJ and INTP

INTJ

With j as 1%

I have updated the table again. Now with percentages. Later if I can bothered I will add the Male & Female percentages, since they are different.

I think most of us here will be "NT" types.

That was exactly my prediction as well, with "SF" being under represented. In fact i'm surprised how skewed the results are... however a sample set of 11 is not much so far. Another oddity is that everyone so far is in a more rare type.

draeath - I put you down as an INTP, but please tell me if you rather be marked as INTJ

Spearka - I put you down as an INTJ, but please tell me if you rather be marked as INTP

Also - if anyone digs deeper to get a better understanding of their type and wants me to change the table, please tell me.

Edited May 4, 2014 by bsalis

Introvert(67%) iNtuitive(12%) Thinking(62%) Judging(33%)

I guess other types just don't like this nerdy rocket-building game. It's too hard, its learning curve is too flat, and even worse, playing it presumes a lot of thinking :3

Edit:

Oh, and it's not massively multiplayer.

Edited May 4, 2014 by koshelenkovv

INTP, and unambiguously so according to every test I've done.

I fully expect KSP players to be overwhelmingly *NT*. Early results also indicate bias towards introversion.

INTJ. From Website: "Introvert(89%) iNtuitive(50%) Thinking(75%) Judging(56%)"

Very interesting lineup for INTJ on the celebrity website, nice seeing Nikola Tesla on there, he's my hero.

INTP

Introvert(56%) iNtuitive(50%) Thinking(38%) Perceiving(33%)

You have moderate preference of Introversion over Extraversion (56%)

You have moderate preference of Intuition over Sensing (50%)

You have moderate preference of Thinking over Feeling (38%)

You have moderate preference of Perceiving over Judging (33%)

I remember taking this test a few years ago, not so different.

Introvert(67%) iNtuitive(75%) Thinking(75%) Judging(44%).

Or, INTJ in short.
The test in the OP rated me as INTP, although other tests tend to say I'm INFP.

INTJ

Introvert(22%) iNtuitive(75%) Thinking(12%) Judging(11%)

Hmm, I guess I'm not as introverted as I prefer to think I am.
INTJ (11%/75%/12%/22%). In previous years, the Introverted would have been much higher, but that's what living in a lot of places does to you.

I got my Dad to do the test. Here's his score:

ESFP

Extravert(1%) Sensing(1%) Feeling(75%) Perceiving(33%)

You have marginal or no preference of Extraversion over Introversion (1%)

You have marginal or no preference of Sensing over Intuition (1%)

You have distinct preference of Feeling over Thinking (75%)

You have moderate preference of Perceiving over Judging (33%)

According to my run through the test today, I'm an INFP. Years ago I was an INTJ. I guess the tumbling rivers of life and time have worn down my sharp corners and turned me into a smooth, rolling pebble.

But then I used to be an arch-rationalist/skeptic, now I'm what I'd call post- or trans-rational. (smiles) Perhaps a better term is 'possibilian'. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Possibilianism

And over the years I've shifted from libertarian to anarchist/voluntaryist.

I haven't taken the test yet, might do later.

Just wanted to say hello to another voluntaryist.

im the type of personality that looses interest after reading the first question. these tests are always a load of crap.

Edited May 4, 2014 by Nuke
